titleStmt.title: An exact relation of the defeat given to a party of the enemies horse neer Cambden. Wherein was taken of the enemies I Colonell, I Lieutenant Colonel. 2 captains, 3 lieutenants, 2 cornets, and colours, 2 colours more, whole bearers fled, 80 horse, 100 prisoners, divers slain, by Serjeant Major Beer. Also a true relation of some losse at the shege at Newarke. And a sermon preached to certain drunken cavaliers at Priscall, the text being malt. Whereunto is added a declaration of a cashierd souldier.
titleStmt.author: Beere, Serjeant Major.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Andrew Coe, according to order,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
